001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.Comparator;
005
006public final class DoubleSupport implements JavaNumberTypeSupport<Double> {
007
008    protected DoubleSupport() {
009    }
010
011    @Override
012    public String name() {
013        return "Double Precision";
014    }
015
016    @Override
017    public Double[] createArray(int length) {
018        Double[] doubles = new Double[length];
019        Arrays.fill(doubles, 0.0);
020        return doubles;
021    }
022
023    @Override
024    public Double[][] createArrayOfArrays(int rows, int columns) {
025        Double[][] doubles = new Double[rows][columns];
026        for (Double[] array : doubles) {
027            Arrays.fill(array, 0.0);
028        }
029        return doubles;
030    }
031
032    @Override
033    public Double multiply(Double first, Double second) {
034        return first * second;
035    }
036
037    @Override
038    public Double divide(Double first, Double second) {
039        return first / second;
040    }
041
042    @Override
043    public Double add(Double first, Double second) {
044        return first + second;
045    }
046
047    @Override
048    public Double minusOne() {
049        return -1.0;
050    }
051
052    @Override
053    public Double one() {
054        return 1.0;
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    public Double zero() {
059        return 0.0;
060    }
061
062    @Override
063    public boolean equals(Double first, Double second) {
064        double diff = first - second;
065        return -1.0e-10 <= diff && diff <= 1.0e-10;
066    }
067
068    @Override
069    public boolean greaterThan(Double first, Double second) {
070        return first > second;
071    }
072
073    @Override
074    public Double squareRoot(Double value) {
075        return Math.sqrt(value);
076    }
077
078    @Override
079    public Double absolute(Double value) {
080        return Math.abs(value);
081    }
082
083    @Override
084    public Double valueOf(double value) {
085        return value;
086    }
087
088    @Override
089    public Comparator<Double> comparator() {
090        return Double::compare;
091    }
092}
